briefdescription.para: Static quaternion to convert a rotation expressed in ENU to a rotation expressed in NED (Z->Y->X convention) on the inertial frame Rotate PI/2 about Z-axis -> Rotate 0 about Y-axis -> Rotate PI about X-axis.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: this quaternion is as valid as the quaternion representing the rotation from NED to ENU (quaternion ambiguity) on the inertial frame

briefdescription.para: Static quaternion to convert a rotation expressed in ENU body frame (ROS base_link) to a rotation expressed in NED body frame (Z->Y->X convention) Rotate 0 about Z-axis -> Rotate 0 about Y-axis -> Rotate PI about X-axis.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: this quaternion is as valid as the quaternion representing the rotation from NED to ENU (quaternion ambiguity) on the body frame

briefdescription.para: Static quaternion needed for rotating vectors in body frames between ENU and NED +PI rotation around X (Forward) axis transforms from Forward, Right, Down (body frame in NED) Fto Forward, Left, Up (body frame in ENU).

Static affine matrix to roate vectors ENU (or NED) -> NED (or ENU) expressed in body frame +PI rotation around X (Forward) axis transforms from Forward, Right, Down (body frame in NED) Fto Forward, Left, Up (body frame in ENU).

memberdef.argsstring: (T depth_command, T altitude_min, T measured_depth, T measured_altitude)
memberdef.name: saturateControlDepthUsingMinAltitude

briefdescription.para: Method to saturate the control in depth.

parameterdescription.para: The minimum altitude (positive distance from the vehicle to the bottom in m)
The measured depth of the vehicle
The measured altitude of the vehicle

simplesect.para: The saturated control of depth such that the vehicle does not surpass the minimum altitude

briefdescription.para: Method to saturate the control in altitude.

parameterdescription.para: The minimum altitude to keep from the ground

simplesect.para: The output command of the altitude saturated such that the vehicle does not surpass the minimum altitude

briefdescription.para: Method to saturate the control in depth.

simplesect.para: The output command of the depth saturated such that the vehicle does not surpass the maximum depth

memberdef.argsstring: (T altitude_command, T measured_depth, T measured_altitude, T max_depth)
memberdef.name: saturateControlAltitudeUsingMaxDepth

briefdescription.para: Method to saturate the control in altitude.

parameterdescription.para: The measured depth of the vehicle
The measured altitude of the vehicle

simplesect.para: The output command of the altitude saturated such that the vehicle does not surpass the maximum depth

briefdescription.para: Use reflections instead of rotations for NED <-> ENU transformation to avoid NaN/Inf floating point pollution across different axes since in NED <-> ENU the axes are perfectly aligned.
Transform a rotation (as a quaternion) from body expressed in ENU (or NED) to inertial frame to a similar rotation (as quaternion) from body expressed in NED (or ENU) to inertial frame.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Check http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/algebra/realNormedAlgebra/quaternions/transforms/ for more details behind these type of transformations towards obtaining rotations in different frames of reference.

parameterdescription.para: quaternion representing a rotation: body frame ENU (or NED) -> inertial frame (in arbitrary convention)

simplesect.para: quaternion represeting a rotation: body frame NED (or ENU) -> inertial frame (in arbitrary convention)

briefdescription.para: Transform a rotation (as a quaternion) from body to inertial frame expressed in ENU (or NED) to a similar rotation (as quaternion) from body to inertial frame expressed in NED (or ENU)

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Check http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/algebra/realNormedAlgebra/quaternions/transforms/ for more details behind these type of transformations towards obtaining rotations in different frames of reference.

parameterdescription.para: quaternion representing a rotation: body frame (in arbitrary convention) -> inertial frame ENU (or NED)

simplesect.para: quaternion represeting a rotation: body frame (in arbitrary convention) -> inertial frame NED (or ENU)

briefdescription.para: Transform a rotation of a rigid body (as a quaternion) from body (ENU or NED) to inertial frame (ENU or NED) to a similar rotation (as quaternion) from body (NED or ENU) to inertial frame (NED or ENU)

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: This function is usefull to convert the attitude of a vehicle from "ROS" quaternion to a typicall literature quaternion (where both the body frame and inertial frames are in ENU). If you are converting a quaternion that expresses the orientation of a sensor with respect to a rigid body's body frame (and not the inertial frame), then you DO NOT WANT TO USE THIS FUNCTION. Body-FRAME NED is not the same as INERTIAL-FRAME NED (this comes once again from the fact that in ned body the x-y axis don't switch like in inertial frame) as explained in the documentation.
Essencial only use this if you are representing a body in inertial frame!

NOTE: Check http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/algebra/realNormedAlgebra/quaternions/transforms/ for more details behind these type of transformations towards obtaining rotations in different frames of reference.

parameterdescription.para: quaternion representing a rotation: body frame (ENU or NED) -> inertial frame (ENU or NED)

simplesect.para: quaternion representing a rotation: body frame (NED or ENU) -> inertial frame (NED or ENU)

briefdescription.para: Transform vector in ENU (or NED) to NED (or ENU), expressed in body-frame. +PI rotation around X (Forward) axis transforms from Forward, Right, Down (body frame in NED) Fto Forward, Left, Up (body frame in ENU).

parameterdescription.para: Vector expressed in body-frame (ENU or NED)

simplesect.para: Vector expressed in body-frame (NED or ENU)

briefdescription.para: Transform a vector in a given frame of reference to another frame of reference.

parameterdescription.para: Vector expressed in the original frame of reference
Quaternion that expresses the orientation of the original frame of reference with respect to the final frame of reference

simplesect.para: Vector expressed in the new frame of reference

briefdescription.para: Transform vector in ENU (or NED) to NED (or ENU), expressed in inertial-frame. ENU <> NED - Invert the Z axis and switch the XY axis.

parameterdescription.para: Vector expressed in inertial-frame (ENU or NED)

simplesect.para: Vector expressed in inertial-frame (NED or ENU)

briefdescription.para: Transform 3x3 covariance matrix in ENU (or NED) to NED (or ENU), expressed in body-frame.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Check https://robotics.stackexchange.com/questions/2556/how-to-rotate-covariance for a detailed explanation of the actual conversion proof for covariance matrices

parameterdescription.para: Covariance matrix expressed in body-frame (ENU or NED)

simplesect.para: Covariance matrix expressed in body-frame (NED or ENU)

briefdescription.para: Transform 3x3 covariance matrix in ENU (or NED) to NED (or ENU), expressed in inertial-frame.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Check https://robotics.stackexchange.com/questions/2556/how-to-rotate-covariance for a detailed explanation of the actual conversion proof for covariance matrices

parameterdescription.para: Covariance matrix expressed in inertial-frame (ENU or NED)

simplesect.para: Covariance matrix expressed in inertial-frame (NED or ENU)

briefdescription.para: Returns the sign of the number.

simplesect.para: 1 if value is positive 0 if value is 0 -1 if value is negative

briefdescription.para: A function that saturates 2 values linearly.

simplesect.para: A value such that value in [min, max]

briefdescription.para: A function to check if two numbers are equal (int, float, double, etc)

simplesect.para: A boolean for true if equal within tolerance, or otherwise

briefdescription.para: Function to convert from quaternion to (roll, pitch and yaw), according to Z-Y-X convention This function is from: https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/issues/444 and the logic is also available at: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conversion_between_quaternions_and_Euler_angles.

simplesect.para: A Vector<T, 3> with the [roll, pitch, yaw] obtained according to Z-Y-X convention

briefdescription.para: Converts a vector of euler angles according to Z-Y-X convention into a quaternion.

parameterdescription.para: An eigen vector of either floats or doubles [roll, pitch, yaw]

simplesect.para: An Eigen Quaternion

briefdescription.para: Gets the yaw angle from a quaternion (assumed a Z-Y-X rotation) NOTE: this function is based on: https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/blob/ros2/mavros/src/lib/ftf_quaternion_utils.cpp which in turn has the theory explained in: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conversion_between_quaternions_and_Euler_angles.

simplesect.para: The yaw angle in radians (assumed a Z-Y-X rotation)

briefdescription.para: Wrap angle between [0, 2PI].

simplesect.para: The wraped angle

briefdescription.para: Wrap angle between [-PI, PI].

simplesect.para: The wraped angle

briefdescription.para: Convert an angle in radian to degrees.

simplesect.para: angle in degrees

briefdescription.para: Convert an angle in degrees to radians.

simplesect.para: angle in radians

briefdescription.para: Method to calculate the diference between angles correctly even if they wrap between -pi and pi.

simplesect.para: The minimum difference between the two angles

briefdescription.para: Compute the 3x3 skew-symmetric matrix from a vector 3x1.

simplesect.para: A 3x3 skew-symmetric matrix

briefdescription.para: Compute the 2x2 skew-symmetric matrix from a constant (int, float or double)

simplesect.para: A 2x2 skew-symmetric matrix

briefdescription.para: Compute the rotation matrix that converts angular velocities expressed in the body frame to angular velocities expressed in the inertial frame (according to Z-Y-X convention) - makes use of small angle approximation.

parameterdescription.para: A vector with 3 elements (roll, pitch, yaw)

simplesect.para: A 3x3 rotation matrix

briefdescription.para: Method that returns a rotation matrix from body frame to inertial frame, assuming a Z-Y-X convention.

parameterdescription.para: A vector with euler angles (roll, pith, yaw) according to Z-Y-X convention

simplesect.para: A 3x3 rotation matrix

briefdescription.para: Convert from spherical to cartesian coordinates. Used mainly with usbl fixes.

detaileddescription.para:
bearing
Horizontal angle between the direction of an object and another object or between it and the true north direction in degrees.
elevation
Angle measured between the horizontal and the vehicle line of sight to the object
range
Distance to the object
Eigen Vector with cartesian coordinates
Authors: Joao Quintas (jquintas@gmail.com) Joao Cruz (joao.pedro.cruz@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Marcelo Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Maintained by: Marcelo Fialho Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Last Update: 14/12/2021 License: MIT File: spherical_coordinates.cpp Brief: Defines all functions related to spherical coordinates conversions
bearing
Horizontal angle between the direction of an object and another object or between it and the true north direction in degrees.
elevation
Angle measured between the horizontal and the vehicle line of sight to the object
range
Distance to the object
Eigen Vector with cartesian coordinates

Authors: Marcelo Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Maintained by: Marcelo Fialho Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Last Update: 10/02/2022 License: MIT File: vehicle_saturations.hpp Brief: Defines functions used for saturating the vehicle inputs to the system

Authors: Andr Potes (andre.potes@gmail.com) Marcelo Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Maintained by: Marcelo Fialho Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Last Update: 14/12/2021 License: MIT File: frames.hpp Brief: Defines all functions related to conversions between ENU do NED frames and vice-versa

NOTE: Most of this code is adapted from mavros https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/blob/master/mavros/src/lib/ftf_frame_conversions.cpp which had as authors Nuno Marques (n.marques21@hotmail.com) and Eddy Scott (scott.edward@aurora.aero)

Authors: Marcelo Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Joao Quintas (jquintas@gmail.com) Joao Cruz (joao.pedro.cruz@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Maintained by: Marcelo Fialho Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Last Update: 14/12/2021 License: MIT File: math.hpp Brief: Defines all functions related to general math functions that can be used anywhere

Authors: Marcelo Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Andre Potes (andre.potes@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Maintained by: Marcelo Fialho Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Last Update: 14/12/2021 License: MIT File: rotations.hpp Brief: Defines all functions related to angle wrapping, rotation matrices, euler angles, convertion to quaternions, etc.

Authors: Joao Quintas (jquintas@gmail.com) Joao Cruz (joao.pedro.cruz@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Marcelo Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Maintained by: Marcelo Fialho Jacinto (marcelo.jacinto@tecnico.ulisboa.pt) Last Update: 14/12/2021 License: MIT File: spherical_coordinates.hpp Brief: Defines all functions related to spherical coordinates conversions
